Client Modules¶

The clients module provides HTTP and RSS feed functionality for fetching data from external sources.

HTTP Client¶

class the_data_packet.clients.HTTPClient(timeout: int = 30, user_agent: str | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

HTTP client for fetching and parsing web pages.

__init__(timeout: int = 30, user_agent: str | None = None)[source]¶

Initialize the HTTP client.

Parameters:

  • timeout – Request timeout in seconds

  • user_agent – Custom User-Agent string

The HTTPClient handles all HTTP requests to fetch web pages. It includes automatic retries, proper error handling, and session management.

Example Usage:

from the_data_packet.clients import HTTPClient

# Create client with custom settings
client = HTTPClient(timeout=60, user_agent="MyBot/1.0")

# Get a webpage as BeautifulSoup object
soup = client.get_page("https://www.wired.com/story/example/")

# Get raw HTML content
html = client.get_raw_content("https://www.wired.com/story/example/")

# Clean up resources
client.close()
__init__(timeout: int = 30, user_agent: str | None = None)[source]¶

Initialize the HTTP client.

Parameters:

  • timeout – Request timeout in seconds

  • user_agent – Custom User-Agent string

get_page(url: str) → BeautifulSoup[source]¶

Fetch a web page and return a BeautifulSoup object.

Parameters:

url – The URL to fetch

Returns:

BeautifulSoup object of the parsed HTML

Raises:

RuntimeError – If the request fails

get_raw_content(url: str) → str[source]¶

Fetch raw HTML content from a URL.

Parameters:

url – The URL to fetch

Returns:

Raw HTML content as string

close() → None[source]¶

Close the HTTP session.

RSS Client¶

class the_data_packet.clients.RSSClient[source]¶

Bases: object

Client for fetching RSS feed data from Wired.com.

__init__() → None[source]¶

Initialize the RSS client.

The RSSClient interacts with Wired’s RSS feeds to discover the latest articles in different categories.

Example Usage:

from the_data_packet.clients import RSSClient

client = RSSClient()

# Get the latest article URL from security feed
url = client.get_latest_article_url("security")

# Get multiple article URLs
urls = client.get_article_urls("guide", limit=5)

# Check supported categories
categories = client.get_supported_categories()
FEED_URLS = {'guide': 'https://www.wired.com/feed/tag/wired-guide/latest/rss', 'security': 'https://www.wired.com/feed/category/security/latest/rss'}¶
__init__() → None[source]¶

Initialize the RSS client.

get_latest_article_url(category: str) → str[source]¶

Get the URL of the latest article from a specific category.

Parameters:

category – The category to fetch from (‘security’ or ‘guide’)

Returns:

The URL of the latest article

Raises:

  • ValueError – If category is not supported

  • RuntimeError – If no articles are found

get_article_urls(category: str, limit: int = 10) → List[str][source]¶

Get multiple article URLs from a specific category.

Parameters:

  • category – The category to fetch from

  • limit – Maximum number of URLs to return

Returns:

List of article URLs

get_feed_data(category: str) → Dict[str, Any][source]¶

Get full feed data for a category.

Parameters:

category – The category to fetch from

Returns:

Dictionary containing feed metadata and entries
